result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody T. Melton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CT# 1 Court Withholds sentence places DEF on 18 months probation conditions of probation fine/costs $831.00,  DNA Sample and surcharge,  restitution ordered TBD with 30 day notice from DOC

$200.00    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 200 surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cody T. Melton in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts,   victim was notified, DEF pleads NC to CT#1 and 2 court finds the DEF guilty
CT# 1 Court Withholds sentence places DEF on 18 months probation conditions of probation fine/costs $831.00,  DNA Sample and surcharge,  restitution ordered TBD with 30 day notice from DOC
CT# 2 Court Withholds sentence places DEF on 18 months probation conditions of probation costs $443.00  DNA Sample and Surcharge     Def. to report to Probation & Parole today.
OFF-  Defendant Cody T. Melton in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 11:00 am.

APPEARANCES:  Defendant Cody T. Melton in court with Attorney Thomas W Duffy.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint.  Court enters NOT GUILTY plea on behalf of DE to Counts 1 and 2.

Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.
